medical_history.chief_complaint: Numerous skin-colored, dome-shaped papules involving the nose, perinasal, melolabial skin, and other facial regions.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first diagnosed with basal cell carcinoma (BCC) at age 50. Symptoms likely started around this time as the lesions progressed slowly with no specific details on duration or intensity provided.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Extraction of all teeth at age 19 due to decay and poor hygiene, history of myopia and cataracts, cataract surgery in 1996, and bilateral inguinal hernia repair as a child.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of basal cell nevus syndrome (BCNS), multiple hereditary infundibulocystic basal cell carcinomas (MHIBCC), multiple hereditary trichoepitheliomas (MHT), or generalized basaloid follicular hamartoma syndrome (GBFHS). The history of the patient's biological father is unknown.
